posts.author: C1QP0X
posts.content:
Funny topic

I've been playing a World of Torr server as of late (mostly by myself haha) but I was thinking I might try out playing as a Wizard on it. Anyways, looking through all the spell changes on these things and such most often just makes my head hurt. I was hoping I could get some character build suggestions! Below is all the relevant PW information.

Spell Changes:

Acid Arrow: Ranged touch attack, no SR
Acid Fog: Allows no SR, damage 5d6 (fortitude 1/2)
Acid Splash: Allows no SR, damage 1d2+1/3 levels
Aura of Glory: Healing increased to 1d6+1/3 levels, also damages hostile undead creatures for the same amount
Awaken: Also adds +1 Natural AC/2 levels and +4 All Saves.
Ball Lightning: Damage increased to 4d6, maximum of 5 missiles per target, 15 missiles in total
Bane: Causes -2 penalty
Bestow Curse: Reduces all attributes by 4
Bigby's Hand Spells: Now use Discipline instead of STR checks, one check every round
Blade Thirst: Now gives Keen effect and +1d8 positive damage. Duration increased to 2 rounds per level
Bull's Strength: Now gives 3 + 1/5 levels of ability increase. Empower Spell increases this by 1 and Maximize by 2. Capped at +7
Burning Hands: Damage increased to 1d6/level
Cat's Grace: Same as Bull's Strength
Cone of Cold: Will additionally slow targets that fail their fortitude save
Contagion: Added Gargantuan AoE
Darkness: Duration halved (1 round per 2 levels)
Daze: Now works on all HDs
Darkfire: Damage granted is 1d6 + 1 per 4 levels of caster with no level cap
Dispel Magic: Spell Focus: Abjuration now adds +2 to dispel checks and Greater Spell Focus: Abjuration adds +4. If the target has Arcane Defense (Abjuration), dispel checks are lowered by 2
Divine Favor: +1 AB/Damage per 4 character levels, to a maximum of 4
Doom: Causes -3 penalty, and the damage penalty is now physical instead of magical
Earthquake: Damage increased to 10d6+1/level. Additionally knocks targets down for 1 round on a failed save
Eagle's Splendor: Same as Bull's Strength
Electric Jolt: 1d3+1/3 levels damage
Elemental Shield: Does not stack with other damage shields
Endurance: Same as Bull's Strength
Energy Drain: Ranged touch attack, no save, drains 2d4+2 levels
Enervation: Ranged touch attack, no save
Flame Arrow: Ranged touch attack, no SR, no reflex save, number of arrows reduced to CL/5 (but minimum arrows increased to 2)
Flame Lash: 4d8+1d8/3 levels damage
Flame Weapon: Damage granted is 1d6 + 1 per 4 levels of caster with no level cap
Flare: 1d2 fire damage, 1d2+1 AB penalty on failed save
Fox Cunning: Same as Bull's Strength
Ghoul Touch: No longer requires a touch attack. Additionally does 1d2 negative damage / 2 caster levels. If the damage kills the target, a ghoul is summoned for the duration
Globe of Invulnerability: Gives 40% immunity to all damage except physical, duration increased to 2 rounds / level
Greater Dispelling: Same as Dispel Magic
Greater Restoration: This spell no longer heals much damage but removes all ill effects
Greater Sanctuary: Duration 3 rounds + 1 round/5 levels, gives 100% spell failure for the duration
Greater Spell Breach: Breaches 1 more effect with Greater Spell Focus: Abjuration. If the target has Arcane Defense (Abjuration), it will breach one buff less
Harm: 30-60 damage depending on target creature size (smaller creatures take more damage). The damage can kill the target
Heal: Heals between 30-60 hp depending on target creature size (smaller creatures are healed more). Heal potions heal a lower amount of HP
Healing Sting: Damage increased to 2d6+2/level
Hold Animal: Duration reduced to 2 rounds + 1 per 5 levels
Hold Monster: Duration reduced to 2 rounds + 1 per 5 levels
Hold Person: Duration reduced to 2 rounds + 1 per 5 levels
Holy Sword: Duration increased to 1 turn/level. Now grants 1d4+1/5 levels divine damage on the weapon instead of the other effects.
Horizikaul's Boom: Now also stuns the target on a failed will save
Ice Dagger: Damage increased to 1d6+1/level, target will be slowed on a failed fortitude save (after failing reflex)
Implosion: Removed +3 DC bonus, now does 1d6 bludgeoning damage/2 levels on all targets that successfully save
Improved Invisibility: Certain things, such as taking damage, may break invisibility. Concealment bonus lowered from 50% to 30%
Incendiary Cloud: Damage increased to 1d6/2 levels, to a maximum of 10d6
Invisibility: Certain things, such as taking damage, may break invisibility
Isaac's Greater Missile Storm: Maximum of 5 missiles per target
Lesser Spell Breach: Same as Greater Spell Breach
Light: Grants +1 Natural AC vs Undead, +2 Spot/Search, -20 Hide/Move Silently
Lightning Bolt: Damage increased to 1d8/level
Mestil's Acid Breath: Allows no SR
Mestil's Acid Sheath: Damage reduced to 1d6+1/level, does not stack with other damage shields
Mind Fog: Lowers Will Saves by 2 even if save is made
Minor Glove of Invulnerability: Gives 25% immunity to all damage except physical, duration increased to 2 rounds / level
Mordenkainen's Disjunction: Same as Dispel Magic
Negative Energy Ray: Additionally drains 2 constitution (will save for 1/2)
Owl's Wisdom: Same as Bull's Strength
Poison: No longer requires a touch attack, poison type changed to more powerful Wyvern Poison, added Gargantuan AoE
Premonition: Gives +3 Dodge AC (stacks with other AC types) and +3 Reflex save instead of DR
Quillfire: Damage increased to 2d8+1/2 levels and damage cap removed. Additionally causes Blindness for 1d2+1 rounds (fortitude negates)
Ray of Frost: Now requires a ranged touch attack. Damage increased to 1d4 + 1/3 levels
Remove Blindness/Deafness: Area of effect increased from medium to colossal
Remove Paralysis: Area of effect increased from large to colossal
Scare: Now applies -2 AB, Damage and Mind Affecting saves to targets of any HD on a failed will save, and fear effect up to 8 HD
Sleep: Maximum HD affected increased to 12, Caster level +1d4 HD of creatures affected in total
Sound Burst: Damage increased to 1d8+1/2 levels, to a maximum of 1d8+10
Stinking Cloud: Allows no SR
Stone Bones: AC bonus increased to +6
Sunburst: Blindness duration 1 round/level, affects all except the caster in the area of effect
Time Stop: Instead of the normal time stop, it freezes creatures in the entire area. Allows SR but no save. Duration is 1 + 1d3 rounds. For every casting of Timestop within the same 5 minute period, the duration you obtain will be at an additional -1 round. This can cause the spell to actually fail on a 3rd consecutive casting!
True Seeing: This spell does NOT grant the Truesight ability, instead it grants See Invisibility, immunity to phantasmal killer and +1 Spot/2 levels
Undeath to Death: Area of effect reduced to Gargantuan. Does 10 damage per level instead of killing instantly (no cap)
Vampiric Touch: Additionally drains 2 strength
Vine Mine: Camouflage bonus increased to +10 Hide and Move Silently
Virtue: Now increases HP by 3
Wall of Fire: Allows no save, damage is now 2d6+1/2 levels
Weird: Damage on a successful fortitude save increased to 4d6+1/level, causes fear for 1d3+2 rounds on a failed will save
Word of Faith: Allows a will save

Other:

Expertise and Imp. Expertise both work while running around, casting spells, using skills, it persists through rest (a bit different from other PWs, I know) so that would totally be useful for magery. It stays turned on til you actually click or hotkey it again to turn it off, or until you enter another mode.

Parry is weird on WoT, too. Every 5 ranks you get +1 AC while in parry mode but the down-side is you lose -2 APR unless you have Imp. Parry, then it's only -1 APR.

Also.. Ranger as a class allow you to track creatures, players, various npcs, etc. I was thinking I might take a level of Ranger to utilize that cool feature? Perhaps grab some trapping skills as well?

OH YEAH! Most importantly the level cap is 25.

PS: If anyone suggests Shadowdancer for a possible Wiz build: one must have 4 levels of SD to gain HiPS.

I'm mainly just not sure on starting stats and such. But if someone would like to suggest a whole wiz build for 25 that's cool too

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Every PW that i read it's rules pretty much has it's own changes to the original game's spells, some of them are good and some of them are bad but there are things that just you can't comprehend. 30 hp's heals are ridiculous by any measure.

As for your mage concept i don't see any "fixes" to the almighty necromancy school, so good old Finger of Death, Wail of the Banshee, Fear and the rest are what you should get if you want a mighty spellcaster, or else you will struggle to kill even a lowly bandit with those maximized IGMS that do 30 damage... Even better (or worse) Torr made those more powerful as i can see here that you can Energy Drain => FoD your opponents with an effectively increased DC. Heck, Daze is better than IGMS now.

The changes to IE are welcome, even more for a mage! Max your parry too since you dont care about APR. I don't know if someone else noticed but i smell some fine cheddar here...
